mainmatter.p: A deduction rule has the form \frac { \Gamma _1 \vdash A_1 \quad \cdots \quad \Gamma _n \vdash A_n}{ \Gamma \vdash A}, where each \Gamma _i \vdash A_i and \Gamma \vdash A is a sequent. The sequents above the line are called antecedents, and the sequent below the line is the consequent.
Applying a deduction rule involves having a collection of sequents which match the antecedents, and deducing the sequent which matches the consequent.
